messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: DALLAS POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION DIVISION
Auto Theft Task Force
SIGNAL: 67A
ITEM NUMBER: A-67098-34
PAGE 47 of 88
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Sarah Mitchell
Sgt. Edward King
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Jacob Wilson
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Laura Sanchez
Sgt. Ryan Clark
( Vehicle Recovery Unit)
Det. Amanda Johnson
Det. Tyler Davis
( Vehicle Recovery Unit)
Det. Kevin Brown
( Vehicle Recovery Unit)
Det. Elizabeth Taylor
Det. Marcus Moore
(General Assignment)
Det. Natalie White
(Vehicle Fraud Unit)
Det. Christopher Smith
(Intelligence Gathering Unit)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, car dealership owner.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
20 JUNE 2034 at around 6:00 PM in the Oak Cliff area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Jacob Wilson
5689
Throughout the investigation, a series of stolen vehicles and falsified documents complicated the case. Officer Martinez, on a stakeout in Oak Cliff, was first to observe suspicious activity at a car lot. Assisting him were Sgt. Laura Sanchez and Patrol Officer Harris, who coordinated a rapid response. Technician Murphy, specializing in vehicle identification, was tasked with verifying the stolen cars. Criminalist Edwards, scrutinizing the documentation, uncovered forgeries that were pivotal in tracking the stolen vehicles. Coroner Dr. Thompson was later consulted to examine an individual involved in a related accident, leading to additional insights into the auto theft ring. Patrol Officer Reed, liaising with local car dealers, gathered intelligence that significantly advanced the investigation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Sarah Mitchell Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Auto Theft Task Force. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Edward King Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Mitchell. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Jacob Wilson Officer Context: Lead investigator for the auto theft case, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Laura Sanchez Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating a rapid response, part of the Vehicle Recovery Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Ryan Clark Officer Context: Vehicle Recovery Unit sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Amanda Johnson Officer Context: Vehicle Recovery Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Tyler Davis Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Vehicle Recovery Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Kevin Brown Officer Context: Vehicle Recovery Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Elizabeth Taylor Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Marcus Moore Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the auto theft case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Natalie White Officer Context: Vehicle Fraud Unit detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Christopher Smith Officer Context: Intelligence Gathering Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Martinez Officer Context: First to observe suspicious activity at a car lot in Oak Cliff. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Harris Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating a rapid response to the suspicious activity. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Murphy Officer Context: Specialized in vehicle identification, verified stolen cars. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Edwards Officer Context: Analyzed documentation, uncovered forgeries linked to stolen vehicles. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Thompson Officer Context: Examined an individual in a related accident, provided insights into the auto theft ring. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Reed Officer Context: Liaised with local car dealers, gathered intelligence on the auto theft ring. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
